page.title: 04THE TOLL HOUSE
page.content: THE TOLL HOUSE. 200 years ago this was built to collect tolls on the road between Bath and Stroud.Built for a small family it has had to be extended.Originally there were two rooms only,now there are seven. Although beside the M4 life is reasonably quiet.The present owner has lived there for seven years but previous owners have been traced back to the Codrington family.2.5 acres of land surround the house where there is a colourful flower garden.Hens and ducks are kept and the eggs sold to passing motorists.In the garden are "cats' eyes" which were on the road, closed when the M4 opened.
